content: the ugly duckling crocheted scarf in seed stitch judith f russell 2014 the seed stitch pattern gives texture and depth to a scarf in yarn and makes heathered yarns that much more spectacular the scarf is gender neutral with or without the embellishments skill level easy size apx 6 inches by 60 inches need one skein caron simply soft or red heart super saver small amounts of contrast color in similar weight for embellishment stripes if desired j hook instructions chain 25 add or decrease width by 2 stitch increments if you want a narrower or wider scarf mark first chain from hook with safety pin or marker row 1 single_crochet in 3rd chain from hook then chain 1 skip a stitch single_crochet in next stitch across the row ending with single_crochet in final stitch where you placed the marker chain 1 and turn row 2 single_crochet in first chain 1 space then chain 1 and single_crochet in the next chain 1 space across chain 1 and turn row 3 and onward repeat row 2 until length is about 60 inches do not chain or turn on final row fasten_off embellishment stripes after the first 10 - 12 row do 2 row contrast color 2 row main color 4 row contrast color 2 row main color 2 row contrast color if you want embellishment at second end then continue with main color until abt 52 inches and add contrast in same pattern as first or just 2 or 4 row of contrast before finishing off with 10 - 12 row of main color note if you use red heart super saver don t be afraid to give the scarf a good wash and dry after you finish a wash and dry with softener or hair conditioner for a hand wash will make a big difference in the feel of the finished product
